reviews.title: Leaked Propane
reviews.review_text: I was going camping in cold weather and brought this for use in my tent. I tested it before I left and it lit and worked. I left the propane tank attached. While on the drive, I noticed the smell of propane in my car. This heater was leaking propane. I immediately disassembled it and continued on. At the campsite, I attached two different bottles of new propane bottles, and you could hear the hiss of a leak. No matter how I careful to make sure it was screwed on and tightened. Ended up not using it in fear of a gas buildup causing suffocation or fire. Returning as soon as I get back home.

Issues I've found: 1)it takes more Force to push the button 2) you have to hold it longer than 30 seconds to get it ignited and start to spread the gas across the surface 3) this is purely a radiant heater and does not have any kind of fan or force to project the heat outward so you practically have to be over top of it to feel the warmth or being an enclosed area like a tent. All that being said, it does provide consistent heat and any heat is better than no heat.

reviews.title: Only burns 2+ hours
reviews.review_text: I agree with the other reviews on the burning length of time. We get about two hours, if that on some and never the three hours as advertised. However, the burn is clean and great for the first hour and a half, then the flames start going smaller and smaller. They have cut the quality or made a negative change because they use to do the three hours as advertised and as they use to. I am pretty much forced to use these as I have not found any other that I like better. We use these in a fireplace. I'm sitting here looking at one barely burning that I put in one hour and fifty five minutes ago and the flame is barely coming out. Now, if I poke it and break it up into small pieces, it will burn big for a few minutes and then dwindle down to nothing rather quickly. They are great to start a new wood fire quickly, like the one person said, "put the log under the wood and then light it". To me they are better than the fire starters to get a fire started quickly. - burn good - no odors - great for starting the wood fire Do not last three hours

reviews.title: burned within 1 hour
reviews.review_text: I live just south of Memphis in Mississippi. It's 1-7-14 and as you all know we are all having unusual artic temps, 10-20 degrees. Even though I left my faucet dripping my water still froze. I know nothing about fireplaces. I live in an apt with a fire place and I've never used it, but I thought I would give it a go in these artic temps. I bought 2 2-hour Duraflame logs from Freds. They lasted even more than 2 hours and I enjoyed the experience. I went to Walmart to check out the selection and bought a 6-pk box of 3-hour Pine Mountain logs. The first log burned big and fast. I thought maybe it did that because I lit it in 4 different places, so I burned another exactly following the lighting directions. The log still burned big and in and 1 hour not 3. Also the air filter on my central heater was black. Hmm, don't know if I'll give Druaflame another try, but definitely will not buy any more Pine Mountain. In fact, I'm going to return the remaining logs. I don't want to use any kind log if my air filter is going turn black. I didn't notice the filter after I burned the Dualame, but it was very noticeable after the pine mountain.

reviews.title: Overall satisfied with product
reviews.review_text: The instructions are a little unclear on how to secure the fireplace liner. The instructions say to use black screws to secure the fireplace, which I don't have. I believe this is just an error in the instructions because I do have other screws that I can use, but it's a bit sketchy to assume they are the correct screws. I would also add that you should read the instructions carefully and not rush. It helps a lot to read two steps at a time. For example, if you're on step 2, read step 3 so you know what to do. I have noticed a few times that what one step says to do makes the following steps more difficult. So knowing what I was going to do next helped me avoid those mistakes. Overall, I am happy with this product, but I do think the price could have been a little lower because this product is not made up of tiny pieces of wood.

reviews.title: Have some patience; it'll be worth it.
reviews.review_text: This took my husband and me about 3 hours to assemble. The locking nuts were quite challenging, as some were defective. We didn't realize at first that they include extra screws and parts—thankfully, because we had about five locking screws that didn't lock properly. You'll definitely need patience! However, once assembled, the final product is sturdy, beautiful, and the fireplace works great. A heads-up: if you only have one electrical outlet for both the fireplace and TV, this setup won't work. The fireplace requires its own dedicated outlet, so you'll need to find another outlet for the TV or other devices.

reviews.title: Needed some fitting
reviews.review_text: I got 3 of these. No cosmetic damage on the outside front and sides that are visible which was an important factor. One was manufactured perfectly but the other 2 had sheet metal forming booboos that needed to be corrected with vise grips and pliers and the kind. If I was not mechanically inclined, it would have probably been a big deal. But as it was, I just bent it back to how it needed to be to allow assembly and it was a minor thing. Fitting the doors so they closed easy was not easy but I banged on it with a hammer in the right places and put spacers on the hinge pins where they needed to go and the results are I am quite happy with all 3.

We got this cabinet to use as a secondary pantry in our kitchen and it is just what we needed for extra dry and canned goods. The only downfall is it was very heavy for me to move the box or assemble alone, so I did have a handy man put it together for me.

So, of course, I opened one very carefully to see if it was a misprint on the box. But it was not Dark Gray and White... Now, what do I do with these items that were wrongly advertised on the Walmart site???

reviews.title: 5-stars...BUT
reviews.review_text: Ok, so I rated this cabinet 5-stars, BUT... Understand, this rating is explicity based on a "you get what you pay for" mentality. It is exactly what I would expect for a sub-$100 cabinet... thin, cheap sheet metal, some screws that strip easily, and sub-par instructions. However, that being said, in the end the cabinet stands (it's fairly sturdy, considering the thin metal), shelves hold, doors work and handle mechanism works and locks (just don't plan on securing your life savings in this cabinet). Provided you set your expectations accordingly, this is a decent cabinet for the price that does what it should.

reviews.title: Looks nice, but not very sturdy
reviews.review_text: I purchased three of these shelving units. So far I have assembled one of the three and placed it in my garage to store various containers of liquids. The shelves look nice and were easy to assemble. While the framing in steel, it is thin steel. It would not be difficult to bend the frame. I didn't expect steel shelving to come in a box labelled "fragile". For the under $30 price I paid, the shelves are okay and will server the desired purpose. If you want sturdy, this is not the item to buy. One minor complaint about the fully assemble unit is that the upper half is not actually attached to the lower half. Eventually, I will use eight half inch bolts to secure the upper and lower halves together. I may return the two unopened boxes.

reviews.title: Flimsy
reviews.review_text: This is two separate units. Not one long unit as pictured. It is not snap together. You will need a hammer. They provide gloves. Use them because the edges are sharp. I did slice my thumb which was my fault because for not wearing the gloves. These units are by no means heavy duty. You can easily bend/twist each section. The shelf board is barely stronger than corrugated cardboard. It's not difficult to assemble by any means though. It's just not what I needed. I wanted something to organize my basement but I don't think these will withstand much weight. I would not buy these again. Plastic would be much more sturdy than this.

went to put it together and once I was on the last step I noticed I am 1 short of the shorter pieces (number 3) and 1 extra of the longer piece (number 2). so now it's 1 shelf short at first i thought it would be no big deal being a shelf short but after put together its not as sturdy as the first one i put together with all the shelves. if it had all the needed parts it would be a 4 to possible 5 stars. overall the product is good quality

reviews.title: Only for light weight items.
reviews.review_text: Assembly is a bit difficult but use a mallot hammer with two people to assemble. As you build up, bottem to top no screws are needed but any metal must be settled into sockets for all four corners and for all five shelves. As I built it, I discovered it was a previous returned item and 2 corner metal posts (of 4) were slightly bent. I couldn't assembe the upper shelves because connections for metal slots became slightly off from corner dents. I returned it to the store. Examine all parts before you build, if NO DENTS, you could build all five levels. 2 people to assemble. Wood shelves are very thin, so is for very light stuff on each shelf. This is not good for medium or heavy containers. I would say each shelf could hold no more than 10 pounds, like towels, blankets and super light hardware, like light weight Christmas decorations.

reviews.title: Not Just For the Guys Anymore
reviews.review_text: We have not yet used this item even though we have carefully checked it out for sturdiness, mobility, and usefulness; we may save it to use as a gift. The entire unit offers multiple storage sections of varying sizes to accommodate both smaller items as well as some larger ones. Having the base section...which is sizeable...offers mobile use when different areas of work are needed. The adjustable handle is also a very handy feature whether one is transporting one storage section, two sections, or all three. Each removeable section is fastened with sturdy clips that are easy to open as well as back clips to be used when one wishes to remove a section to use separately(see bottom pic). Although this item may be viewed more as something the fellows would use, I believe the ladies will also benefit from possessing one of these units for their gardening needs outside or even for crafts designs as sometimes many small decorative pieces are needed; the top section has multiple small compartments for such items to prevent spillage. I believe most anyone could find a handy use for this particular product that would offer many years of service and options. The only drawback to this unit as I see it would be the heavy weight of some larger tools inside along with the other sections filled to capacity; but, having the cart on wheels makes it mobile so it may not be a problem for the guys. Nice product...thank you.

reviews.title: A flexible storage system for all your needs
reviews.review_text: The HART Mobile Tool Storage System is do-it-yourselfers' ultimate solution to tool storage and organization challenges. It has three stackable sections. The bottom section is wide enough to hold power tools such as a reciprocating saw, a drill, etc... The middle section is not as big, but would still fit smaller tools such as a jigsaw, a sander, etc… plus has a tray for small tools such as a level, tape measure, square etc. This tray can be used in either one of the bottom two sections. The top section is a tray with ten removable compartments for small items such screws, nails, drill bits, etc. Depending on your job need, you have the option to use all three sections at once, only the base section or the base plus one of the other two. The whole system can be rolled around with the help of two solid 7-inch wheels and an extendable handle, a great feature that makes reaching your job site a lot easier especially if you have to go up or down the steps. The top two sections can be released from the storage system and have strong handles so you can carry them away if space is restricted for the whole system. It is worth mentioning that the top tray has a lid that sinks into the ten compartments creating a seal for your items so they don't scatter inside the tray and it is clear so tray contents are visible. Each section interlocks with the section below it for stability while rolling it around and for even more security, the bottom two sections can be locked with padlocks. All three sections come equipped with two strong latches to secure their lids down. If you are a do-it-yourselfer, a craftsman or just need a flexible storage system, The Hart Mobile Tool Storage System is for you. It has a look and feel of high quality construction and presents a variety of storage and organization options depending on your need. Its two wheels and retractable handle allow you to move part or all of the storage system around with ease.

reviews.title: Do Not Recommend
reviews.review_text: This 4-shelf storage cabinet with doors would be a great place to store items out of sight and organized, whether you use it in the garage, study, craft room or game room. However, it is plastic and not very sturdy. The shelves can hold only 30 pounds so the items that can be stored in this cabinet are limited. I’m not sure I’d trust a shelf to hold a 6-pack of soda. When you open the box, be surprised to find cracked or broken pieces, missing or duplicate pieces. If you receive all the pieces in good condition, be extremely careful during assembly. This storage cabinet is fairly easy to put together. No tools are required but a rubber mallet may come in handy. Read the assembly instructions, lay out all the parts, take your time and try not to get frustrated. It took me and my daughter longer than it would for most people, even though both of us have years of experience assembling boxed furniture. I cannot, in good faith, recommend this storage cabinet. A metal/steel cabinet, with or without doors, would be a much better investment even though the cost is more.

reviews.title: Buy Something Else If For Outside Use
reviews.review_text: I liked that it's hard plastic and that the shelves do seem to be able to hold the 50lbs per shelf. I also really liked that you don't need any tools to put it together. However, this is not suitable to be outside where rain can get to it. Especially because the doors do not close all of the way (including on the sides), water will be able to get in if it is rained on. This is also expensive for what it is. A better price would have been about $80. If you'll have this in the house and don't need the doors to completely close, buy it. If you need it to be outside, buy something else.

reviews.title: Good points, bad points
reviews.review_text: The product itself is good except for what I am guessing is a piece that is supposed to represent a middle hinge on the doors. Didn't work, both sides broke off the first time I opened the doors. No matter...doors function fine without them. Big plus, this whole assembly requires NO hardware. On the negative side the instructions leave a lot to be desired especially as far the pictures go. Black on black so doesn't work. It also doesn't work far as the parts being labeled. Took the light hitting just right that I finally even noticed they were labeled. I was about halfway through assembly before I saw them...duh. It did go together well even with the broken middle "hinges?" Works well, Shelves are sturdy so all in all I am good with the unit. My biggest bone to pick is Walmart delivery. When I first saw this product in the store there were 3 units sitting on the shelf. I went home and price checked the unit in other places and not only did Walmart have the best price my CC provided a link that allowed me to get 5% cash back.....BONUS. Yeah, so I ordered through the link for pickup the next day. I soon get a noticed telling me not available for pickup and they would ship it to me. Now I'm thinking WOW they sold the 3 units I saw sitting on the shelf that morning. I get the unit a couple days latter via, FEDEX. Assemble it, get it into use...happy camper. UNTIL I am shopping at Walmart a day or so later and low and behold.....all 3 units are still sitting on the shelf. Gotta wonder whether it was a management issue, some weird policy issue or lazy employee issue but someone really needs to address that. 5% cash back to me and God only knows what they paid FedEx to ship it to me. On a $120 purchase the profit margin must be out the roof for them to make any money on that deal. Rant over.

reviews.title: Poor quality for what it needs to be used for
reviews.review_text: This hyper tough 4 shelf utility cabinet is made of durable polypropylene material. It can hold up to 30lb per shelf when evenly distributed. The total cupboard weighs 36.4 pounds. It has a matte black finish and comes with detailed instructions to assemble it. Each piece is labeled with a letter that is engraved in the plastic. Assembled it is 18.5 inches long, 25.47 inches wide and 69.38 inches tall. It can be used in bedrooms, bathrooms, patios, garages, and more. It has 4 shelves that are moveable. When I put it together the main part of cupboard was super easy and understandable. Once it came to putt in the shelves it got very confusing. They didn’t fit, took multiple tried to get one shelf to stay in and would require me to push the left “wall” in to get it to snap together. Overall it will work well for holding light simple items but the shelves do collapse sometimes. It is poor quality and flimsy for what it is.

reviews.title: Easy assembly
reviews.review_text: I found this HyperTough Garage Storage Soultions Cabinet quiet purposeful. At 25" wide x 18" deep and almost 70" high with 4 adjustable shelves. All pieces are durable plastic much like a tote. I placed it in my workshop/shed to hide my garden supplies, small tools and fertilzers. I also am keeping my car care/washing chemicals, waxs, soaps towels. It took me about an hour to assemble. It would have been nice to have assembly instructions but I managed to figure it out. Nice not to have to use any screws , nuts or bolts, all the pieces just snapped into place. I did have to get out my rubber mallot as some pieces I had ti disassemble as there was an order to put the pieces together. 20 pieces altogether. Which included doors on the front to enclose the shelves. I had a small 1 inch pieces that broke off but you can't see it from tbe front. Overall I am satisfied with my HyperTough storage cabinet.

reviews.title: Broken pieces, flimsy, confusing instructions

We just built it anyway, as the broken parts in the second box were usable even with cracks. Parts of the instructions were unclear, but we got through it. At the end, it feels flimsy, but it does look nice. We were too nervous to put anything heavy in it, since it doesn't seem like it would hold well. Overall, if you need something 'hyper tough', I wouldn't say this is it. It's adequate for lighter items though, and it does look nice.

reviews.title: Hyper Tough Plastic 4-Shelf Garage Storage Utility

You do get what you pay for I guess. The instructions are lacking details in places but you can generally figure it out. There was one step missing, where it showed the picture but didn't say anything about installing the part. I did received mine with a hole in the box and 2 pieces were damaged. They were still usable and it isn't worth the hassle to replace them. The shelves are kind of difficult to "lock down" because the plastic is so bendable/warped. There is a QR code that says is a link for video instructions, but it only takes you to the Wal-Mart site for the item. I saw nowhere on that page a link for the instruction video. It is unfortunate you can only upload 2 pictures. I have many to show, good and bad.

reviews.review_text: I haven't had time to assemble the shelves. Everyone wants an instant review. So everything I've written is just me hoping for the best.

reviews.title: Different uses for a Storage rack
reviews.review_text: This is my 3rd storage sleeve I've ordered in the last 4 months. They are used for different things like for extra food pantry, kitchen appliances, and clothes rack.

reviews.title: That's a high load rating.
reviews.review_text: For the price it's good. Just need to understand the weight used to test these things is very evenly distributed across the whole shelf. Put the whole weight in the middle and it's definitely going to sag.
I thought I ordered the silver one. I have had these shelfs for many years they last a very long time. I will reorder in silver, but I also need another blk.

reviews.title: It'll do. Just do your homework before ordering.
reviews.review_text: Not quite as heavy duty as I expected. There are so different variations of these products, make sure to check dimensions and capacities before ordering.
Is a necessity in the kitchen, will be getting more. Can choose how far apart or close together you want the racks, depending on what your using it for, easily hang things,kitchen tools etc.
I like it except you need to put lighter items near the end. the sides are not as sturdy as I thought. the large tide pod containers make it droop when placed on the ends.

reviews.title: It's OK
reviews.review_text: A few weeks ago order some rollers drawers to go between my washer & dryer and they hold quite a bit but the bottles have too be a certain size. So I order 2 of these shelves one to fit on my washer & one for my dryer I order them so I can put any size jugs on them. I usually get family size liquid detergent. One fits my dryer great my boyfriend did have too bend them down a little the directions tell you that you might have too. The top of my dryer is straight but my washer top is rounded the shelf don't fit it as good we had too fix the washer where the shelf will lean up against the wall so we could use it without falling off but evently that will rub my wall. So they are great if the top of your washer & dryer is straight across at the top if they are rounded you need too find something else. Before I ordered these shelves I read the reviews some people complained about the bottles falling off my bottles havene't fell off yet.

reviews.title: It works, but just barely
reviews.review_text: This was such a great idea...but I didn't think of the curve on the top of the washer or dried! It won't set level so I have to be extra careful when I take things on and off of it. Also, it wasn't made to hold the larger sizes of product. It moves around as you take things off it. It would probably be OK if my drier didn't have that slight curve to it. The front arms need to be a bit longer. Also, the back arms need to be bent to work for the machine which can cause that to lean back some which is why the front arms need to be longer. I wish there was a better way to secure it to the machine. I'm going to have to figure out a way to make it stay firmly on the machine. I think even if I didn't have that slight curve the would be a huge problem.
I thought that the shelves came with all the hardware to put them up need To order the strips to put them up

When the Shelf is in place and you want to pick the soap to put in the washer - I open the washer lid then you can't obtain the soap because the lid is open and the shelf is too low. The Shelf needs to be 8 inches higher and attached to the wall to be useful.

reviews.title: Laundry Shelf over Washer or Dryer
reviews.review_text: I wish this shelf would hold some weight.
It does not fit GE Profile washer or dryer. It tilts backwards. It does hold bottles. I am using it and it does what I needed.

reviews.title: Thank goodness it was inexpensive.
reviews.review_text: I ordered 2, one for my washer and one for the dryer. (both Whirlpool Cabrio) Returned the one for the washer since it would not fit. I adjusted the other and it fits, but not sturdy at all. I only can out very light items such as dryer sheets on it because it is not sturdy enough for detergent, etc.., Ask me how I know:(

reviews.title: 4 stars
reviews.review_text: It could be a little more adjustable. As well as sturdier when in place

I was able to set this on my washing machine immediately, and I haven't yet bolted it down. It works ok where it is, but it blocks the lid a little bit. I'm sure this would be better on my dryer, but other things are there.

reviews.title: Space Saving
reviews.review_text: Does what it says and gives extra storage over the washer and dryer. Mines is away from the wall a bit so I don't have that extra support. I can still store quite a few things there, just not the extra heavy detergents.

reviews.title: Ok if you have additional screws.
reviews.review_text: This fit ok, but only because it's being supported by the wall. Another issue we had were the screws that came with it. They were too small and went through the hole. Luckily my husband had more screws and washers and we had to use those instead.

reviews.title: Important before you buy!
reviews.review_text: Please note. To use this item you must have 10 or more inches behind the washer/dryer or it will not fit. My laundry is in a closet so I returned it.
Does the job, but item was bent when I got out of box.
Pretty flimsy but I guess it works kinda cheap looking

reviews.title: takes some adjusting
reviews.review_text: Had to do some bending on the braces to make mine fit level. Also the back braces will slip down the machine if not adjusted just right. Feet need more grip. Think its worth 8 or 9 dollars in my opinion. Difinitely have to pull the washer/dryer away from the wall about 6-8 inches. Great space saving idea though.

reviews.title: An ok shelf for atop dryer or washer
reviews.review_text: Just needs to have a lil bigger screws, and easier way to put together...was very awkward.

reviews.title: Laundry Shelf
reviews.review_text: Make sure you measure the space behind your washer.. I did not do it and the shelf is to wide..May have to pull washer out some...

reviews.title: Recommend
reviews.review_text: If your washer water hoses are the same level of your washing machine, you will have to place it in your dryer. It wasn't level on my washer. One of the screws didn't work. Easy to replace. Gives me more space in my tiny laundry room. Recommend

reviews.title: Handy Item
reviews.review_text: I use it for light weight items. I've never tried a gallon of bleach or laundry detergent.

reviews.title: Shelf on the dryer
reviews.review_text: It holds the dryer sheets and other little things and keeps things from falling behind the dryer.

reviews.title: does the job
reviews.review_text: does the job; we needed it to do. didn't have any cabinets above washer and dryer that would laundry supplies.

reviews.title: Camp kitchen on wheels.
reviews.review_text: I was looking for some kind of container that I could put my camping kitchen in. I like that there are 3 compartments and it has wheels. I don't know how long the latch will last. The latch is not very strong. This same toolbox is sold on Amazon for 20.00 more but comes with some small containers that fit in one of the top side compartments. The extra containers are helpful for small kitchen stuff like clips, ziplocks, and spices for my camp kitchen. I bought one from both places. The second toolbox I use for my small tent supplies. I am 62 year old woman so the wheels on them are nice. I just came back from my first camping trip. They worked well for the trip but I don't know how long they will last.

reviews.title: ok for orice
reviews.review_text: it works kinda a royal pain to get to snap shut on top. have to press together quick and hard.

reviews.title: Needs lock and key
reviews.review_text: Noticed after receiving the toolbox, it didn't come with a lock and key-yet there's an opening for one. Will have to buy my own lock and key; other than that, I really like the roominess for all my tools and that it comes with a large handle to move the toolbox around safely.

reviews.title: storage
reviews.review_text: likes: has handle and wheels,both sides slides open, able to sit on one end, room for some big tools. dislikes: not able to sit on both ends because one side has clear plastic cover

reviews.title: Rain Resistant, Not Rainproof
reviews.review_text: Purchased to keep on-the-go picnic incidental items (plates, eating utensils, napkins, trash bags) for the boat. The interior space stayed fairly dry. The top tray was not even water resistant.

reviews.title: product was fine but left on the proch unboxed
reviews.review_text: would have like to see it boxed...it was a christmas gift and husband seen what it was sitting on the porch as is.
Without a visual, I didn't know exactly what I was going to receive. But it turned out to be ok
The photo portrayed better quality than the actual item
Has plenty of room but needs more level dividers. Some level with dividers.

reviews.title: Lots of room
reviews.review_text: I bought this for a couple of circular saws since they didn't have a case of their own and the Master Loader has plenty of room. The only drawback is that the upper "dividers" don't have true dividers or inserts to use to keep small items seperate.

reviews.title: Question: can this be locked with a master lock or
reviews.review_text: Does this support using a master lock to keep tools safe when left on a jobsite

reviews.title: Temporary shelf until movers furniture arrived
reviews.review_text: I needed something to be temporary shelf until movers could bring over furniture. Better to use for 3 shelves instead of the 5. Be OK for a child's room for little toys, or paper goods. I put cut out card boards on the shelves to give extra sturdiness and flat surface for items, heavier items on 1st shelf to give a better foundation for others 4. For the price I guess I expected a little better quality.

reviews.title: Very light weight shelving
reviews.review_text: These shelves are for light weight items. You need to be careful during assembly and not push too hard or use a hammer. I used some longer wood clamps with large wood pads to spread out the pressure on the thin plastic shelves. There are no end caps for the bottom so it is a hollow leg on the floor. I used some pads to better stabilize the shelf unit.
I did add some tubing to make the bottom shelf higher off the ground. Using it for a drying rack.
if you need extra shelves and arent overly concerned with appearance these serve the purpose
Easy to put together, but kind of wobbly, but it fits our needs
The shelf is good to hold towel's but nothing heavy.
overall, this is a decent small rack. the plastic shelves are a bit fragile. i broke one putting it together by using too much force.

reviews.title: Cheaply made
reviews.review_text: Will be returning this item piled bent would not and could not connect

On this particular one, the slider tab isn't easily moved. I haven't tested the container's drawers to see if it had stops to keep them from coming all the way out, with/without the trays being filled with eggs. Also, it was packaged well.

reviews.title: Serves purpose
reviews.review_text: It's nice but you have to be careful you don't pull the drawers out to fast or the eggs will dump on the floor.
I recommend anybody it needs their eggs the quantity they get this is safe space in the refrigerator

reviews.title: egg storage
reviews.review_text: Pull out egg draw isn't very sturdy but serves my purpose.
